sect1.title: Introduction to HPCC4J
sect1.para: The HPCC Systems for Java is a collection of Java based APIs and tools which help developers interact with HPCC Systems servers and tools in a relatively simple, and standardized fashion.
The project houses multiple HPCC Systems centric Java based APIs and tools.
The project is available on Github in the hpcc4j repository.

sect2.title: wsclient
sect2.para: The API which standardizes and facilitates interaction with HPCC Systems Web based Services (ESP Web services).
The project is based on stub code generated from WSDL using Eclipse tools based on Apache Axis.
Provides a mechanism for actuating HPCC Systems web service methods.

sect2.title: clienttools
sect2.para: Java based interface to HPCC Systems client tools. Currently only interfaces with the ECLCC Server.

sect2.title: rdf2hpcc
sect2.para: RDF data ingestion tool to HPCC.Systems Based on Apache Jena and is dependent on wsclient.

sect2.title: dfsclient
sect2.para: Distributed data ingestion & extraction library. Uses internal HPCC Systems binaries to efficiently read and write data remotely in parallel. Supports generic and custom dataset creation and translation through IRecordBuilder & IRecordAccessor interfaces

sect2.title: commons-hpcc
sect2.para: Set of common use libraries used in conjunction with a wide array of HPCC Systems related java clients.

entry.para: As is common in Java client communication over TLS, HPCC4J based clients targeting an HPCC cluster over TLS will need to import the appropriate certificates to its local Java keystore.
*One way to accomplish this is to use the keytool packaged with Java installations. Refer to the keytool documentation for usage.
